title: ‘Kidnapped’ Shannon Matthews offered stunning tell-all book deal to heap more shame on mum Karen
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SHANNON Matthews has been offered a stunning tell-all book deal over her fake kidnapping ordeal at the hands of her mum Karen. 
The youngster was just nine-years-old when she became the victim of a hoax kidnapping in 2008 after she disappeared on her way home from school. PA:Press Association ‘Missing’ Shannon Matthews, who was found a mile away in the base of a bed, has been offered a book deal to tell her horrific story PA:Press Association 5 Shannon’s mum Karen was jailed for eight years for her part in faking the kidnap of her daughter in 2008 
Now a string of leading publishing houses have contacted social services to ask about the possibility of signing her up to write an explosive book about her days held captive. 
While her mum Karen and co-plotter Michael Donovan were convicted of kidnapping her, many details of the crime still remain a mystery. 
The only way they will ever be made public will be if Shannon decides to speak out. related stories Karen Matthews' pal insists evil mum wasn't 'smart enough' to mastermind kidnap plot BBC MOORSIDE DRAMA What's happened to 'Britain's most hated mum' since BBC drama The Moorside aired? 'I KNEW SHE WASN'T MISSING' Karen Matthews admits lying about Shannon's disappearance in chilling police interview A COLD CASE Here's everything you need to know about episode two of Shannon Matthews drama, The Moorside 'FIND SHANNON' What happened to Shannon Matthews after the notorious fake kidnapping which gripped the nation? 
Shannon turned 18 last year after being taken into care following Karen’s arrest and eight year jail term. 
But under strict guidelines put in place by a judge after Karen Matthews’ conviction, she is not free to talk to the media until she is 21. 
The nine-year-old was found tethered and drugged inside the base of a double bed at relative Michael Donovan’s grotty flat almost a month after she disappeared. 
It later emerged Karen Matthews, Shannon’s mum, who was going out with Donovan’s nephew Craig Meehan at the time – had devised the elaborate plot with her accomplice in a bid to claim the £50,000 reward money for finding Shannon. 
They had planned to release the schoolgirl, “discover her” then take her to a police station and claim the reward before splitting. Karen Matthews admits lying about Shannon's disappearance in chilling police interview Getty Images Michael Donovan held terrified Shannon captive at his dingy home for 24 days Getty Images 5 Karen was going out with Donovan’s nephew Craig Meehan at the time of the staged kidnapping 
Shannon’s ordeal, and the massive search involving the whole of the local community when she disappeared, is now the subject of BBC drama The Moorside. 
A source close to the family revealed: “Shannon could make a fortune and there isn’t a person in Britain who would begrudge her a penny of any money she received – well maybe one person. 
“All the money in the world can’t take away the horrible fact that her own mother thought so little of her that she had her drugged and hidden in a grotty flat just so she could try and get her hands on a few thousand pounds." Celebrations for friends and family of missing Shannon Matthews as she's found alive Getty Images 5 Karen made a number of public appeals for information on her daughter’s whereabouts during the month she was missing 
The source added: “That is something that Shannon has to live with every day of her life so if she can try and make her life a little better by writing a book and earning some money from it that she should grasp the opportunity with both hands.” 
Karen Matthews was jailed for eight years for her part in faking the kidnap of her daughter in 2008.
